original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati isigilismiṁ pabbate.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā rājagahe viharati isigilismim pabbate
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha on the Isigili Slope.
There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:

original: “Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ vebhāraṁ pabbatan”ti?
analyzed: passatha no tumhe bhikkhave etam vebhāram pabbatanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, do you see the mountain Vebhara?”

original: “Etassapi kho, bhikkhave, vebhārassa pabbatassa aññāva samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti.
analyzed: etassa api kho bhikkhave vebhārassa pabbatassa aññā ava samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that mountain Vebhara had a different name in the past.

original: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ paṇḍavaṁ pabbatan”ti?
analyzed: passatha no tumhe bhikkhave etam paṇḍavam pabbatanti
translated: Do you see the mountain Pandava?”

original: “Etassapi kho, bhikkhave, paṇḍavassa pabbatassa aññāva samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti.
analyzed: etassa api kho bhikkhave paṇḍavassa pabbatassa aññā ava samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that mountain Pandava had a different name in the past.

original: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ vepullaṁ pabbatan”ti?
analyzed: passatha no tumhe bhikkhave etam vepullam pabbatanti
translated: Do you see the mountain Vepulla?”

original: “Etassapi kho, bhikkhave, vepullassa pabbatassa aññāva samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti.
analyzed: etassa api kho bhikkhave vepullassa pabbatassa aññā ava samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that mountain Vepulla had a different name in the past.

original: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, etaṁ gijjhakūṭaṁ pabbatan”ti?
analyzed: passatha no tumhe bhikkhave etam gijjhakūṭam pabbatanti
translated: “Bhikkhus, do you see the Gijjhakūṭa Hill?”

original: “Etassapi kho, bhikkhave, gijjhakūṭassa pabbatassa aññāva samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti.
analyzed: etassa api kho bhikkhave gijjhakūṭassa pabbatassa aññā ava samaññā ahosi aññā paññatti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that Gijjhakūṭa Hill had a different name and a different designation in the past.

original: Passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, imaṁ isigiliṁ pabbatan”ti?
analyzed: passatha no tumhe bhikkhave imam isigilim pabbatanti
translated: Bhikkhus, do you see the Isigili Hill?”

original: “Imassa kho pana, bhikkhave, isigilissa pabbatassa esāva samaññā ahosi esā paññatti.
analyzed: imassa kho pana bhikkhave isigilissa pabbatassa esā ava samaññā ahosi esā paññatti
translated: “Bhikkhus, that Isigili Hill had this very name and this very designation in the past.

original: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhave, pañca paccekabuddhasatāni imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsino ahesuṁ.
analyzed: bhūta pubba bhikkhave pañca paccekabuddha satāni imasmim isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsinaḥ ahesu
translated: Bhikkhus, in the past five hundred paccekabuddhas lived on this Isigili Hill for a long time.

original: Te imaṁ pabbataṁ pavisantā dissanti, paviṭṭhā na dissanti.
analyzed: te imam pabbatam pavisantā dissanti paviṭṭhāḥ na dissanti
translated: When they entered the hill, they were seen to disappear.

analyzed: tam enam manussāḥ disvā evam āhasu
ayam pabbataḥ ime isī gilati iti

original: ‘isigili isigili’ tveva samaññā udapādi.🔽Ācikkhissāmi, bhikkhave, paccekabuddhānaṁ nāmāni;
analyzed: isigili isigili tu eva samaññā udapādi  ācikkhissāmi bhikkhave paccekabuddhānam nāmāni
translated: And that is how the Isigili Hill got its name.🔽“Bhikkhus, I shall expound the names of the paccekabuddhas;
I shall recite the names of the paccekabuddhas.
I will teach you the names of the Independent Buddhas.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and pay careful attention to what I say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato

original: “Ariṭṭho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;🔽upariṭṭho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: ariṭṭhaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi  upariṭṭhaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi
translated: “The Independent Buddha named Ariṭṭha lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.🔽The Independent Buddha named Upariṭṭha lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.

original: tagarasikhī nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;🔽yasassī nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: tagarasikhī nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi  yasassī nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi
translated: The Independent Buddha named Tagarasikhī lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.🔽The Independent Buddha named Yasassin lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.

original: sudassano nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: sudassanaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi
translated: The Independent Buddha named Sudassana lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.

original: piyadassī nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: piyadassī nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: gandhāro nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: gandhāraḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: piṇḍolo nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: piṇḍolaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: upāsabho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: upāsabhaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: nīto nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: nītaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: tatho nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi,
analyzed: tatho nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: sutavā nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi;
analyzed: sutavā nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismin pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi

original: bhāvitatto nāma, bhikkhave, paccekasambuddho imasmiṁ isigilismiṁ pabbate ciranivāsī ahosi.
analyzed: bhāvitattaḥ nāma bhikkhave paccekasambuddhaḥ imasmin isigilismim pabbate cira nivāsī ahosi
translated: The Independent Sambuddha called Bhāvitatta had lived for a long time on this Isigili mountain.
Those who are the seven seers, free from danger, free from fear,
Who have attained Awakening by themselves,🔽Listen as I recite the names of those who are pure, the best of men,

analyzed: sudassanaḥ piya dassī ca su sambuddhaḥ
translated: Sudassana, Piyadassin, and the well-awakened Susambuddha,
Independent Buddhas, who have destroyed the conduit to existence,

analyzed: hiṅgū ca hiṅgo ca mahā anubhāvā
translated: Hiṅgū, and Hiṅga, who are of great power.
The two Jālini Munis, and Aṭṭhaka,
Then the Buddha Kosalla, and also Subāhu,

original: Aṅgo ca paṅgo ca guttijito ca;🔽Passi jahi upadhidukkhamūlaṁ,
analyzed: aṅgo ca paṅgo ca gutti jito ca 🔽passi jahi upadhi dukkha mūla
translated: Aṅga, Paṅga, and Guṭṭhita,🔽Having seen, they abandoned the root of suffering, the cause of rebirth,

analyzed: a sayhaḥ khema abhirataḥ ca sorataḥ

translated: Bhāradvāja, who bore his last earthly frame.
Tissūpatissa, who cut the bonds of existence,

analyzed: upa sikhi taṇha chidaḥ ca sikhari

original: Buddho ahu maṅgalo vītarāgo,🔽Usabhacchidā jāliniṁ dukkhamūlaṁ;
analyzed: buddhaḥ ahu maṅgalaḥ vīta rāgaḥ  usabha chidā jālinim dukkha mūla
translated: The Buddha was Maṅgala, free from passion,🔽Usabhacchidā, who cut the net, the root of suffering;
He attained the peaceful state, Uposatha,
Sundara, whose true name was Saccanāma.

analyzed: kaṇhaḥ ca buddhaḥ su vimutta cittaḥ
ete ca aññe ca mahā anubhāvā

translated: Paccekabuddhas, who have ended the round of births,
Who have gone beyond all bondage, the great seers,

analyzed: parinibbute vandatha appameyyā iti 🔽isigili suttam niṭṭhitam chaṭṭha
translated: Pay homage to those who have attained the immeasurable.”🔽The Discourse on the Seers is finished.
